Class xml_utils

java.lang.Object
  gov.anl.ipns.Util.File.xml_utils

public class xml_utils
extends java.lang.Object

Provides utilities for reading through sections of an xml file representing a DataSet sequentially

Method Detail

getTag

public static java.lang.String getTag(java.io.InputStream is)
Gets the next tag name. This may be an end tag

This finds the next "<" reading past everything else

Use getEndTag if the "<" has been consumed

getEndTag

public static java.lang.String getEndTag(java.io.InputStream is)
Use this instead of getTag if the leading < has already been read. This happens with the getValue method

getErrorMessage

public static java.lang.String getErrorMessage()
Returns an error message or null if no error

getNextAttribute

public static java.util.Vector getNextAttribute(java.io.InputStream is)
Reads the next xml attribute in a tag.

Returns:
A vector with two elements. The first element is the xml attributes key and the second its value as a String

setError

public static boolean setError(java.lang.String Message)
Reports the message to the status pane then returns false

skipAttributes

public static boolean skipAttributes(java.io.InputStream is)
Skips to the end of the xml attributes associated with a tag
    Use this only one time after a getTag, getEndTag, or getAttribute method call

getValue

public static java.lang.String getValue(java.io.InputStream is)
Returns the value associated with the tag

Must be invoked after the tag and all attributes have been dealt with

skipBlock

public static java.lang.String skipBlock(java.io.InputStream is)
This will ignore all values in a block

Invoke this method AFTER the tag and all its attributes have been dealt with(">" has been read)
